item.title: Skydiving first-person shooter Aerial_Knight’s Dropshot announced for PC
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/03/skydiving-first-person-shooter-aerial-knights-dropshot-announced-for-pc

  • PC

Finger blast your way to survival.

Aerial_Knight, the developer behind Aerial_Knight’s Never Yield and Aerial_Knight’s We Never Yield, has announced Aerial_Knight’s Dropshot, a fast-paced first-person shooter where five players must race against time to grab the only parachute to survive a fall from the sky. It will be available for PC via Steam. A release date was not announced.

Here is an overview of the game, via its Steam page:

About

Aerial_Knight’s Dropshot is a fast-paced, heart-pounding first-person shooter where five characters. You and four Enemies are racing to grab the one parachute as you fall from the sky. Be the first to the ground alive. But with bullets flying, every second counts. Outfall your opponents, avoid enemy fire, and use your Finger Gun to take out Enemies

You’re armed with a limited number of Finger bullets. Finger blasting Enemies and clear your path to victory, Use the slipstreams from Enemies to gain speed, but they’ll try to take you down before you reach the ground.

Five fall but only one will land.

Key Features

  • Survive the Fall – Race against four other players to reach the ground first—and stay alive.
  • Limited Ammo – Start with only (X) bullets. Use them wisely to eliminate threats or protect yourself.
  • Slipstream Speed – Use your enemies’ slipstreams to gain speed, but they can do the same to you.
  • Quick Rounds – Each round lasts 30 to 45 seconds—fast-paced action that never lets up.
  • Dynamic Visuals – Stunning environments and thrilling perspectives as you plummet toward the earth.
  • Intense Soundtrack – Pulse-pounding music and sound effects with some style.

Live out your dream of finger-blasting multiple enemies as you all fall to your death.

item.title: Amerzone: The Explorer’s Legacy remake ‘From 1999 to 2025’ trailer
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/03/amerzone-the-explorers-legacy-remake-from-1999-to-2025-trailer

  • PC
  • PS5
  • Xbox Series

A look at the adventure game's evolution.

Publisher Microids and developer Microids Studio Paris have released a new trailer for the remake of Benoit Sokal’s 1999-released adventure game Amerzone: The Explorer’s Legacy, comparing the 1999 original to the 2025 remake. Additionally, digital pre-orders for the game are now available.

Get the latest details below.

Experience the Evolution: A Classic Reborn

The new trailer offers a glimpse into how Amerzone: The Explorer’s Legacy has been meticulously reworked for today’s gamers while preserving the essence of its timeless storytelling.

Key Enhancements

  • Revamped Visuals and Immersive Atmosphere – Explore a fully reimagined Amerzone, now with breathtaking 3D environments, enhanced lighting, and richer details.
  • Expanded Storytelling and New Features – While staying faithful to the original plot, the remake includes additional narrative elements, deeper character interactions, and refined dialogues.
  • Modernized Gameplay and Controls – Intuitive mechanics ensure smoother interactions, making puzzle-solving and exploration more seamless.
  • Customizable Difficulty Settings – Choose between Adventure Mode for a challenging experience or Traveler Mode for a more relaxed journey.

Try the Free Demo Today

Can’t wait until launch? A free playable demo is now available on PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, and PC via Steam! Step into the shoes of a journalist uncovering the secrets of the mysterious Amerzone. Even better—your progress in the demo will carry over to the full game upon release!

Amerzone: The Explorer’s Legacy is due out for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, and PC via Steam on April 24. A demo is available now.

Watch the trailer below.

item.title: Steel Hunters launches in Early Access on April 2
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/03/steel-hunters-launches-in-early-access-on-april-2

  • PC

Wargaming's new free-to-play mech shooter.

Free-to-play player-versus-player-versus-environment mech shooter Steel Hunters will launch in Early Access for PC via Steam on April 2, developer Wargaming announced.

“We want to build Steel Hunters with you,” Wargaming said in a statement. “By starting in Early Access we can refine and expand the game together ensuring every shot fired and every Hunter unleashed is finely tuned. And don’t worry—this won’t be a drawn-out process. Our goal is to move quickly to a full release once your feedback has helped us polish the core experience.”

The Early Access version represents “a polished foundation of Steel Hunters,” including core gameplay mechanics, maps, Hunters, and progression systems. The full version will feature more content, improved quality-of-life features and progression, and polished mechanics based on community feedback. The Early Access version will also initially launch without monetization to focus on refining gameplay. Monetization will be introduced gradually over the course of Early Access.

Here is an overview of the game, via its Steam page:

About

After a cataclysmic event, Hunters were created by mankind to safeguard the collection of an extraterrestrial resource crucial to human survival, known as Starfall. Driven by ruthless factions, these fearsome mechanical giants have now become the key to dominate the scarce resource across the ruins of a green but abandoned Earth.

Key Features

  • Master Mechanical Giants – Discover multiple Hunter playstyles and their destructive weapons, gear, mods, and abilities. Unleash raw power and obliterate your rivals.
  • Achieve Duo Symbiosis – Elevate your teamwork in the hunting grounds. Mastering your Hunters’ unique abilities will keep you alive, but it’s only by displaying perfect team synergy that you’ll secure a victorious extraction.
  • Tactics Over Reflexes – Quick reflexes alone won’t cut it. Instead, sound tactics will carve your path to extract with Starfall. Will you charge headfirst through other teams or exploit the terrain to outmaneuver them? Every hunt matters.
  • Customize Your Hunter – Each Hunter favors a distinct playstyle and has a unique progression system, making them a true menace in battle. Collect boosters and gear to gain an advantage in combat against your rivals.
  • Leave a Trail of Destruction – Take control of an unstoppable machine. Smash through buildings to ambush your rivals or use structures as cover until they collapse under enemy fire.
  • Dynamic Player-Versus-Player-Versus-Environment Fights – Traverse the land to pursue dynamic objectives with multiple player-versus-environment encounters. Just keep in mind that when you’re not hunting, you’re being hunted.

item.title: JDM: Japanese Drift Master delayed to May 21
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/03/jdm-japanese-drift-master-delayed-to-may-21

  • PC

No longer due out on March 26.

Developer Gaming Factory has delayed open-world racing game JDM: Japanese Drift Master from its previously planned March 26 release date to May 21. It will be available for PC via Steam, Epic Games Store, and GOG.

“After careful consideration, we have decided to move the launch date from March to May,” Gaming Factory said in an update. “We want to keep our promise to release a game that meets our high standards, so that when you finally get your hands on the game, it’s nothing short of exceptional. The extra time will allow us to fine tune the final details and provide the best possible experience for everyone. As such, the new launch date is now set for May 21. Thank you for your patience, understanding, and continued support.”

Watch a new trailer below.
